There are many different pharmacy opportunities to consider such as a relief pharmacist, clinical pharmacist, community pharmacist to name some.

Community pharmacists are the most visible type of pharmacist in the UK, and like GP’s, are part of the NHS family. Community pharmacist can also be known as Chemists and can be found on the high streets, next to medical practices, in hospitals or in large supermarkets.

 

As a community pharmacist your job would be all about helping patients and customers, assessing their conditions and making decisions about which medicines they should take. You’ll be involved in depending medicines and offering your patients advice and practical help on keeping healthy. It’s a very responsible job and you will be highly respected member of the community.

 

Here are 4 pro’s and con’s to consider before you take that Community Pharmacist role.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner column_margin=”default” text_align=”left”][vc_column_inner column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_position=”all” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” overlay_strength=”0.3″ column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid” bg_image_animation=”none”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row type=”in_container” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” scene_position=”center” text_color=”dark” text_align=”left” overlay_strength=”0.3″ shape_divider_position=”bottom” bg_image_animation=”none”][vc_column column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_position=”all” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_link_target=”_self” column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” overlay_strength=”0.3″ column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid” bg_image_animation=”none”][vc_custom_heading text=”1. The hours are usually regular” font_container=”tag:h2|font_size:42|text_align:left|color:%2389c03d” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row type=”in_container” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” scene_position=”center” text_color=”dark” text_align=”left” overlay_strength=”0.3″ shape_divider_position=”bottom” bg_image_animation=”none”][vc_column column_padding=”padding-3-percent” column_padding_position=”all” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_link_target=”_self” column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” width=”1/2″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” overlay_strength=”0.3″ column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid” bg_image_animation=”none”][vc_column_text]

 

A common reason amongst community pharmacists is the hours are sociable and are set each week.  This enables the Pharmacist to have a home/ work life balance.

You will have to handle a variety of responsibilities. This may include things like vaccinations, medication therapy management, comprehensive medication reviews, handling inventory, supervising staff, handling budgets as well as dispensing prescriptions There is a real shortage of community pharmacists in the UK” font_container=”tag:h2|text_align:left|color:%2389c03d” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row type=”in_container” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” scene_position=”center” text_color=”dark” text_align=”left” overlay_strength=”0.3″ shape_divider_position=”bottom” bg_image_animation=”none”][vc_column column_padding=”padding-1-percent” column_padding_position=”right” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_link_target=”_self” column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” width=”1/2″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” overlay_strength=”0.3″ column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid” bg_image_animation=”none”][vc_column_text]In 2019, there were on average 2 pharmacies in the UK per 10,000 people and only 11,539* qualified community pharmacists. Therefore, 1 community pharmacist will be servicing nearly 6,000 people in their community.  There were over one billion prescriptions dispensed in 2019, which on average works out at 237 prescriptions dispensed each day per pharmacist. Which means there is a real shortage of pharmacists for the community. These numbers are only increasing so the demand for community pharmacists will only increase.

Although there was a report in 2013 stipulating that there were to be a surplus of pharmacists by 2013, that situation has now reversed and there is mounting concern among NHS leaders from across England that there are not enough pharmacists to meet demand.

There is a higher shortage of community pharmacists in rural and remote areas of the UK, which is only going to be made worse as pharmacy student numbers dwindle.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column column_padding=”padding-6-percent” column_padding_position=”top” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ phone_text_alignment=”default” overlay_strength=”0.3″ column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid” bg_image_animation=”none”][vc_column_text]Being a community pharmacist does come with its own drawbacks but what job doesn’t! You will have some tired feet and some bad customer experience stories to tell, but the job can also be extremely rewarding and satisfying.

As the demand for pharmacists and more specifically community pharmacists continue to outweigh supply, we are more likely to see an upward trajectory in average salaries across the board for the community pharmacist, as you become a precious resource to the NHS.

As a community pharmacist you will take on additional business responsibilities beyond your pharmacy qualification, this will give you with the knowledge and the skills to possibly even set up your own Chemist in the future.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner column_margin=”default” text_align=”left”][vc_column_inner column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_position=”all” that is a right fit for you. Prime Pharmacy is your number one pharmacy recruitment of choice. We only do pharmacy recruitment and specialise in placing our candidates into the best company for them, not just taking into consideration work experience but culture fit, work life balance and many other factors that help determine your next pharmacy career move.

Get in touch with one of our expert recruitment team today to discuss your options on 01623 360089 or alternatively you can contact us on email: talent@primepharmacyrec.com

Check out our jobs page fore the latest pharmacy roles in the marketplace: https://primepharmacyrec.com/pharmacist-jobs/

Follow our LinkedIn company page, where you will have access to the latest roles not necessarily advertised and to keep up to date with the latest pharmacy news: https://www.linkedin.com/company/51661523/
